data.title: Restaurant Brands reaffirms growth outlook, targets 99% franchised model
data.description:
Ahead of its Investor Day presentation on Thursday, Restaurant Brands International (QSR)  reaffirmed its profit and restaurant growth outlook for 2026 and announced plans to return excess free cash flow to its investors.

“As we look toward 2028 and beyond, we see a highly franchised, asset-light business delivering consistent 5%+ net restaurant growth, predictable earnings growth, and strong double-digit total shareholder returns. The strength of our brands and the quality of our teams position us to compound value for all our stakeholders for many years to come," CEO Josh Kobza said in a statement on Thursday.

Over the coming years, QSR plans to become a 99% franchised business and set a goal of ~1,800 net new restaurants per year by 2028, driven by increased Firehouse Subs, Tim Hortons, and Popeyes in the U.S. and Canada, with Firehouse Subs expected to contribute half of that growth.

In China, QSR expects to open 300-400 new restaurants per year by 2028 and 1,100 internationally, excluding China, with top growth markets in India, Mexico, France, Japan, and the UK.

The company also reaffirmed its algorithm of 3%+ comparable sales and 5%+ net restaurant growth, both of which will continue to support an average of 8%+ organic adjusted operating income growth through 2028.

Restaurant Brands (QSR) is actively working to refranchise the Burger King US company restaurant portfolio to a base of 300-500 home market restaurants and place Popeyes China and Firehouse Brazil with long-term local partners, both of which are expected to be completed by the end of 2027. 

Finally, QSR will resume share repurchases with ~$500M expected in 2026, increasing over time once it achieves investment-grade status. Additionally, QSR is committed to growing its dividend to a 60% payout ratio over the long term. To that end, QSR recently announced that it would pay an increased dividend of $0.65 per share on April 2 to shareholders of record as of March 19.

data.title: Synopsys' FY26 guidance likely conservative as analysts reiterate strong ratings
data.description:
Synopsys (SNPS) first quarter fiscal 2026 results demonstrated surging revenue growth, but shares were down slightly during early market action on Thursday, as analysts pointed out the company provided conservative guidance.

Synopsys slipped 3% during early market action on Thursday.

"Although the team did not raise its full-year revenue outlook—consistent with their typical approach early in the fiscal year—we believe Synopsys is positioned to return to its beat-and-raise cadence as the year progresses, driven by continued strength in hardware and strong design activity in AI and leading-edge chip designs," said J.P. Morgan analysts, led by Harlan Sur, in a Thursday investor note.

J.P. Morgan reiterated its Overweight rating and a hefty $650 price target.

"While 2026 is expected to be a transition year, Synopsys has numerous initiatives underway to unlock growth and enhance monetization, including integrated solutions (Synopsys/Ansys) and GPU acceleration of both core SNPS and ANSS workloads (better pricing due to increased efficiency)," Sur added.

Morgan Stanley also retained its Overweight rating and $550 price target.

Bank of America Research reiterated its Buy rating but lowered its price target to $515 from $560.

"SNPS's muted growth outlook for their IP business still relies on sequential IP growth through the year, culminating in a heavy 4Q given license timing," said BofA analysts, led by Vivek Arya, in a note. "However, as seen in FY25E, these licenses may result in difficult to predict revenue that may disrupt FY26E targets. SNPS saw organic China decline YoY with no expectations for improvement in the near-term contrasted with CDNS expecting China to grow in-line with the corporate average (+12% YoY) with domestic foundry competition a potential structural headwind."

Competitor Cadence Design Systems (CDNS) was down about 1% on Thursday. Siemens (SIEGY) was up 1.6%.

data.title: TORM declares $0.70 dividend
data.description:
• TORM (TRMD) declares $0.70/share interim dividend.
  • Payable March 25; for shareholders of record March 12; ex-div March 12.
  • The distribution for the quarter is equivalent to 82% of net profit and reflects the Distribution Policy.
  • The payment date is 25 March 2026 to all shareholders on record as of 12 March 2026, and the ex-dividend date is 11 March 2026 for the shares listed on Nasdaq OMX Copenhagen and 12 March 2026 for the shares listed on Nasdaq New York.
  • See TRMD Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.
